member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Content.Social.Post
member.summary: A post is a representation of the data used to submit to particular social channels (e.g. Twitter Corporate, Twitter Marketing, Facebook, etc). A post is a child item of the Message class. A message can have multiple posts. Therefore, you should access this through Message.Posts rather than accessing it directly. It is possible to have more than one post per social media type, for example, if the user has two Facebook channels and selects both of them when publishing a message, then there will be one message (the parent) and two posts (one for each social channel).

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Content.Versioning.Diff
member.summary:
This Class implements the Difference Algorithm published in "An O(ND) Difference Algorithm and its Variations" by Eugene Myers Algorithmica Vol. 1 No. 2, 1986, p 251.
There are many C, Java, Lisp implementations public available but they all seem to come from the same source (diffutils) that is under the (unfree) GNU public License and cannot be reused as a sourcecode for a commercial application. There are very old C implementations that use other (worse) algorithms. Microsoft also published sourcecode of a diff-tool (windiff) that uses some tree data. Also, a direct transfer from a C source to C# is not easy because there is a lot of pointer arithmetic in the typical C solutions and i need a managed solution. These are the reasons why I implemented the original published algorithm from the scratch and make it avaliable without the GNU license limitations. I do not need a high performance diff tool because it is used only sometimes. I will do some performace tweaking when needed.
The algorithm itself is comparing 2 arrays of numbers so when comparing 2 text documents each line is converted into a (hash) number. See DiffText().
Some chages to the original algorithm: The original algorithm was described using a recursive approach and comparing zero indexed arrays. Extracting sub-arrays and rejoining them is very performance and memory intensive so the same (readonly) data arrays are passed arround together with their lower and upper bounds. This circumstance makes the LCS and SMS functions more complicate. I added some code to the LCS function to get a fast response on sub-arrays that are identical, completely deleted or inserted.
The result from a comparisation is stored in 2 arrays that flag for modified (deleted or inserted) lines in the 2 data arrays. These bits are then analysed to produce a array of Item objects.
Further possible optimizations: (first rule: don't do it; second: don't do it yet) The arrays DataA and DataB are passed as parameters, but are never changed after the creation so they can be members of the class to avoid the paramter overhead. In SMS is a lot of boundary arithmetic in the for-D and for-k loops that can be done by increment and decrement of local variables. The DownVector and UpVector arrays are alywas created and destroyed each time the SMS gets called. It is possible to reuse tehm when transfering them to members of the class. See TODO: hints.
diff.cs: A port of the algorythm to C# Copyright (c) by Matthias Hertel, http://www.mathertel.de This work is licensed under a BSD style license. See http://www.mathertel.de/License.aspx
Changes: 2002.09.20 There was a "hang" in some situations. Now I undestand a little bit more of the SMS algorithm. There have been overlapping boxes; that where analyzed partial differently. One return-point is enough. A assertion was added in CreateDiffs when in debug-mode, that counts the number of equal (no modified) lines in both arrays. They must be identical.
2003.02.07 Out of bounds error in the Up/Down vector arrays in some situations. The two vetors are now accessed using different offsets that are adjusted using the start k-Line. A test case is added.
2006.03.05 Some documentation and a direct Diff entry point.
2006.03.08 Refactored the API to static methods on the Diff class to make usage simpler. 2006.03.10 using the standard Debug class for self-test now. compile with: csc /target:exe /out:diffTest.exe /d:DEBUG /d:TRACE /d:SELFTEST Diff.cs 2007.01.06 license agreement changed to a BSD style license. 2007.06.03 added the Optimize method. 2007.09.23 UpVector and DownVector optimization by Jan Stoklasa (). 2008.05.31 Adjusted the testing code that failed because of the Optimize method (not a bug in the diff algorithm). 2008.10.08 Fixing a test case and adding a new test case.

member.summary: Find the difference in 2 texts, comparing by textlines.
member.param: A-version of the text (usualy the old one)
B-version of the text (usualy the new one)
member.returns: Returns a array of Items that describe the differences.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Content.Versioning.Diff.DiffText(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find the difference in 2 text documents, comparing by textlines. The algorithm itself is comparing 2 arrays of numbers so when comparing 2 text documents each line is converted into a (hash) number. This hash-value is computed by storing all textlines into a common hashtable so i can find dublicates in there, and generating a new number each time a new textline is inserted.
member.param: A-version of the text (usualy the old one)
B-version of the text (usualy the new one)
When set to true, all leading and trailing whitespace characters are stripped out before the comparation is done.
When set to true, all whitespace characters are converted to a single space character before the comparation is done.
When set to true, all characters are converted to their lowercase equivivalence before the comparation is done.
member.returns: Returns a array of Items that describe the differences.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Content.Versioning.Diff.Optimize(Dynamicweb.Content.Versioning.DiffData)
member.summary: If a sequence of modified lines starts with a line that contains the same content as the line that appends the changes, the difference sequence is modified so that the appended line and not the starting line is marked as modified. This leads to more readable diff sequences when comparing text files.
member.param: A Diff data buffer containing the identified changes.

member.summary: Find the difference in 2 arrays of integers.
member.param: A-version of the numbers (usualy the old one)
B-version of the numbers (usualy the new one)
member.returns: Returns a array of Items that describe the differences.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Content.Versioning.Diff.DiffCodes(System.String,System.Collections.Hashtable,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function converts all textlines of the text into unique numbers for every unique textline so further work can work only with simple numbers.
member.param: This extern initialized hashtable is used for storing all ever used textlines.
ignore leading and trailing space characters
member.returns: a array of integers.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Content.Versioning.Diff.SMS(Dynamicweb.Content.Versioning.DiffData,System.Int32,System.Int32,Dynamicweb.Content.Versioning.DiffData,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: This is the algorithm to find the Shortest Middle Snake (SMS).
member.param: lower bound of the actual range in DataA
upper bound of the actual range in DataA (exclusive)
lower bound of the actual range in DataB
upper bound of the actual range in DataB (exclusive)
a vector for the (0,0) to (x,y) search. Passed as a parameter for speed reasons.
a vector for the (u,v) to (N,M) search. Passed as a parameter for speed reasons.
member.returns: a MiddleSnakeData record containing x,y and u,v

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Content.Versioning.Diff.LCS(Dynamicweb.Content.Versioning.DiffData,System.Int32,System.Int32,Dynamicweb.Content.Versioning.DiffData,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: This is the divide-and-conquer implementation of the longes common-subsequence (LCS) algorithm. The published algorithm passes recursively parts of the A and B sequences. To avoid copying these arrays the lower and upper bounds are passed while the sequences stay constant.
member.param: lower bound of the actual range in DataA
upper bound of the actual range in DataA (exclusive)
lower bound of the actual range in DataB
upper bound of the actual range in DataB (exclusive)
a vector for the (0,0) to (x,y) search. Passed as a parameter for speed reasons.
a vector for the (u,v) to (N,M) search. Passed as a parameter for speed reasons.

member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the specified area can be deleted.
member.param: The area for which to determine if it can be deleted.

member.remarks:
If the Area is a master area (The primary version of a website in contrast to language versions of the same website), and it has language versions. The area cannot be deleted until the language versions has been deleted.
If it is not a master area, the area can be deleted.

member.returns: True if the area can be deleted, otherwise false.
member.remarks:
If the Area is a master area (The primary version of a website in contrast to language versions of the same website), and it has language versions. The area cannot be deleted until the language versions has been deleted.
If it is not a master area, the area can be deleted.

member.summary: Handles everything related to HttpContext for Dynamicwebs PDF generation.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Frontend.PdfHttpStreamHandler.HttpStream
member.summary: Sends the PDF document stream, in a correctly formatted HTTP response. The HTTP client, receiving this response, prompts the user whether to open or save the PDF stream. The HttpContext.Current.Response stream is ended by calling Dispose.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Frontend.PdfHttpStreamHandler.HttpStream(System.String)
member.summary: Sends the PDF document stream, in a correctly formatted HTTP response. The HTTP client, receiving this response, prompts the user whether to open or save the PDF stream. The HttpContext.Current.Response stream is ended by calling Dispose.
member.param: Name of the file the browser should receive. Not a physical file. I.e. "YourDocument.pdf"

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Frontend.PdfHttpStreamHandler.HttpStream(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Sends the PDF document stream, in a correctly formatted HTTP response. The HTTP client, receiving this response, prompts the user whether to open or save the PDF stream. The HttpContext.Current.Response stream is ended by calling Dispose.
member.param: The data as a byte array.
Name of the file the browser should receive. Not a physical file. I.e. "YourDocument.pdf"

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Frontend.PdfHttpStreamHandler.Finalize
member.summary: GC calls this Finalize if the programmer forgot to call Dispose on the PdfCreator object.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Frontend.PdfHttpStreamHandler.Dispose
member.summary: Implements the dispose method to actively clean up unmanaged code. The programmer calls dispose on the PdfCreator to clean up unmanaged code, instead of relying on GC to call Finalize which intern calls Dispose. GC.SuppressFinalize is called to prevent GC to call Dispose again (through finalize).

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Frontend.PdfHttpStreamHandler.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: The real destructor. Calls can be induced from GC or by the programmer. In tDynamicweb.he first case (GC Induced) managed objects are not supposed to be garbage collected since the GC is already aware of them, only unmanaged objects are 'collected'. In the last case (Programmer Induced) managed code and unmanaged code is cleaned up immediately.
member.param: If true managed objects than this object (Me) might own are disposed too otherwise only disposing unmanaged code objects

member.value: Returns the cleaned value of the property - using the method.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Frontend.UrlHandling.UrlNode.PathExact
member.summary: Gets or sets the exact path for this node if needed - overwrites the auto generated path to this item with a specific value, i.e. "/MyProduct" instead of "/Products/TheGroup/MyProduct".
member.remarks: This can be set to any valid URL. i.e. "/MyProduct", "Feed.xml", "MyData.json", "/bikes/mountainbike.html", "/MyPage.aspx?Parameter=value" etc.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Frontend.UrlHandling.UrlNode.PathUnique
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique path of this node after it has been indexed.
member.value: This property holds a value after nodes in an index has been indexed and the path of the node is duplicated. I.e if the same url tree have 2 nodes named /home, one will be named /home-1

member.value: true if ignored in child paths; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the name of this item will not include the parent path structure for its path.
member.value: true if ignore parent path; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the querystring elements of the parent nodes are ignored. I.e. True for pages, but false for products since they also need their Groups querystring and value.

member.summary: Used for getting a searchfriendly version of a Dynamicweb url with just the PageID

member.returns: The searchfriendly url to the specified PageID, i.e: /Products/Product1.aspx

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation
member.summary: Represents the navigation object used to generate the xml for navigations

code.title: How to generate a navigation xmldocument

example.code: Dim xmlNav As New Frontend.XmlNavigation(PageView) xmlNav.AbsolutePath = True xmlNav.UrlEncode = True Return xmlNav.XML(0, 1, 99, Frontend.XmlNavigation.Expand.All)

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.Expand
member.summary: Defines which pages in the navigation tree to include in the generated xml node set.

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.Expand.All
member.summary: Include all nodes in all the specified levels in the tree.

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.Expand.Path
member.summary: Includes the active path and their siblings.

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.Expand.PathOnly
member.summary: Includes the active path without any siblings. A breadcrumb.

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.Expand.None
member.summary: Tree is not expanded. Only the specified level is included.

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.NavigationType
member.summary: Defines what the generated xml should be used for.

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.NavigationType.Menu
member.summary: Used for website navigation.

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.NavigationType.Sitemap
member.summary: Used for sitemaps. Does not include nodes that are not marked with "Include in sitemap" on the pages properties.

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.NavigationType.Breadcrumb
member.summary: Used for breadcrumbs. Does not include nodes that are not marked with "Inclue in breadcrumb" on the pages properties

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.LayoutNavigationSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout navigation settings. The navigation settings is a collection of the settings set on a UL navigation node in layout templates, and are added to the navigation XML in the NavigationTree/Settings/LayoutNavigationSettings node with each setting as an attribute with value.
member.value: The layout navigation settings as a setting/value colletion.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.LayoutNavigationAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout navigation attributes. The navigation attributes is a collection of the attributes set on a UL navigation node in layout templates, and are added to the navigation XML in the NavigationTree/Settings/LayoutNavigationAttributes node with each attribute from the UL as an attribute with value in the XML.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.Include
member.summary: Gets or sets the include mode. Defines if a pages Include, ShowInLegend and ShowInSitemap are taken into consideration when including nodes in the XML

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.IncludeMode
member.summary: Defines the modes deciding if pages Include, ShowInLegend and ShowInSitemap are taken into consideration when including nodes in the XML

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.IncludeMode.All
member.summary: Includes all nodes no matter if they are not marked for Include, ShowInLegend and ShowInSitemap

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.IncludeMode.Default
member.summary: Only include nodes depending on their Include, ShowInLegend and ShowInSitemap setting and property.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Frontend.XmlNavigation.UrlEncode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the names in the urls should be Dynamicweb.Context.Current.Server.UrlPathEncoded.
member.value: true if URL encode; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the urls inlcudes the protocol and hostname.

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Modules.ContentModule
member.summary: Responsible for outputting the HTML for your module in the frontend. A module can be attached to a paragraph in the administration. ContentModule is responsible for having the paragraph return some module output. Inherit this class and override the GetContent method to return the HTML for the module as a string.
member.remarks: The class created by inheriting ContentModule needs and attribute AddInName or ModuleName with a module system name specified. The module system name needs to be a-z and 0-9 and no spaces etc.

code.description: How to inherit ContentModule and override GetContent
How to use module annotations to provide module settings

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Modules.ContentModule.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Instance created by Dynamicweb when attaching a module to a paragraph.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Modules.ContentModule.Pageview
member.summary: Gets the PageView instance and gives you information about the current page that your module is used in. It gives you access to properties like the Page, the AreaID, information like style sheets and templates that are effective and it provides access to the current User of the page.

member.summary: Gets or sets the paragraph rendering the instance of this module.

example.code: template.SetTag("Text", Properties.Value("HelloText"))

code.title: How to get a value from ther property collection

example.code: template.SetTag("Text", Properties.Values["HelloText"]);

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Modules.ContentModule.GetContent
member.summary: Override this method and return the HTML output for the module.
member.returns: Must return the markup that renders the module.
member.remarks: The markup returned is what is inserted into the template tag ParagraphModule in the paragraph template.

code.description: How to inherit ContentModule and override GetContent

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Modules.ContentModule.InitializeModule(Dynamicweb.Content.Paragraph,Dynamicweb.Frontend.PageView)
member.summary: Initializes the instance of a content module. Dynamicweb calls this method when a ContentModule instance is created when attached to paragraph. Can be overridden.
member.param: The paragraph creating the instance of this module
An instance of the current pageview being showed
member.remarks: Used internally. Dynamicweb handles the initialization and this method should normally not be called, but only overriden if needed.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Modules.ContentModule.RequestContext(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of Name in HTTP query string or post variables. Instead of using Request.QueryString or Request.Form. INFO: Calling this function is context sensitive to the paragraph the module is attached to. That means it will only return a value if PID=123 equals the ParagraphID of the paragraph currently attaching the module or if PID is not specified. This is usefull when the same module is attached several times on the same page and you want different states of the modules on each paragraph. I.e. adding a querystring variable PageNum=2 would cause 2 instances of the module on the same page to change to page 2 when using normal request. If changed to PID=123&PageNum=2 and using RequestContext would make only one of the instances go to page 2.
member.param: Name of the value in the request collection
member.returns: The value of the specified key
member.remarks: By default the return value has been SQL Escaped (Database.SQLEscapeInjection)

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridContainer
member.summary: Represents a container with grid enabled (dwcontent element with setting grid:true;grid-settings:file.json;grid-mode:auto).

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridContainer.Settings
member.summary: Gets or sets the settings for the grids.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridContainer.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the grid rendering mode. Can be either Auto or InlineTemplate. Setting this to Auto tells Dynamicweb to insert markup for containers, rows and columns. Setting this to InlineTemplate tells Dynamicweb to not insert markup - that will need to be handled in the template using ParagraphColumnClass*, ParagraphIsLast, ParagraphSwitchRowAfterCurrent and ParagraphSwitchRowAfterNext tags.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridContainer.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the build-in grid type that can be used instead of a grid-settings file.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridContainer.Container
member.summary: Gets or sets the container.
member.value: The originating container as a instance.

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridContainer.GridMode
member.summary: GridMode represents the rendering mode of the grid. grid:true;grid-mode:auto

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridContainer.GridMode.Auto
member.summary: Auto tells Dynamicweb to insert markup for containers, rows and columns.

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridContainer.GridMode.InlineTemplate
member.summary: InlineTemplate tells Dynamicweb to NOT insert markup for containers, rows and columns - that will need to be handled in the template using paragraph grid template tags/ParagraphViewModel

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridContainer.GridType
member.summary: GridType represents built-in grids using setting grid:true;grid-type:bootstrap3|Table3Columns

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridContainer.GridType.Bootstrap3
member.summary: The bootstrap3

member.name: F:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridContainer.GridType.Table3Columns
member.summary: The table3 columns

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings
member.summary: GridSettings represents how a grid should behave - how many columns, the format etc. Serialized and deserialized to disk by the object

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns in the grid.
member.value: The number of columns that the grid supports. The default is 12

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.ColumnsSmall
member.summary: Gets or sets the columns supported in the UI for small devices, i.e. 6 and 12 out of 12 columns.
member.value: List of columns supported on small devices. The default is 6, 12
member.remarks: If the list is empty, small device classes will not be supported in UI and in templates to make the implementation more simple

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.ColumnsMedium
member.summary: Gets or sets the columns supported in the UI for medium devices, i.e. 4, 6 and 12 out of 12 columns.
member.value: List of columns supported on medium devices.The default is null meaning medium devices are not defined by default supporting only small and large displays
member.remarks: If the list is empty, medium device classes will not be supported in UI and in templates to make the implementation more simple (Default)

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.ColumnsLarge
member.summary: Gets or sets the columns supported in the UI for large devices (desktop), i.e. 3, 4, 6, 8, 9 and 12 out of 12 columns.
member.value: List of columns supported on large devices. The default is 3, 4, 6, 8, 9 and 12

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.ColumnDefaultSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default size of new columns or paragraphs that does not have a column value set.
member.value: The default size of the column. The default is 12
member.remarks: If is changed, this setting should be changed accordingly

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.ColumnClassSmall
member.summary: Gets or sets the column css class used for small devices, i.e. col-sm-{columns}
member.value: The column class for small devices.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.ColumnClassMedium
member.summary: Gets or sets the column css class used for medium devices, i.e. col-md-{columns}
member.value: The column class for medium devices.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.ColumnClassLarge
member.summary: Gets or sets the column css class used for large devices, i.e. col-lg-{columns}
member.value: The column class for large devices.

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.ContainerStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the markup used for container start, i.e. >div class="container" id="{containerId}"<
member.remarks: {containerId} is needed as part of the value of the ID attribute

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.ContainerEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the markup used for container end, i.e. >/div<

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.RowStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the markup used for row start, i.e. >div class="row" id="{rowId}"<
member.remarks: {rowId} is needed as part of the value of the ID attribute

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.RowEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the markup used for row end, i.e. >/div<

member.name: P:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Designer.GridSettings.ColumnStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the markup used for column start, i.e. <div class="{columnClasses}">
member.remarks: {columnClasses} is needed as part of the value of the class attribute

member.summary: Gets or sets the markup used for column end, i.e. >/div<

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Template
member.summary: Loads HTML (XSLT) based templates and expose methods for setting dynamic values and loops. Returns a parsed version of the template replacing template tags with dynamic values.
member.remarks:
Templates are HTML or XSLT files placed in the /Files/Templates folder of a Dynamicweb installation. Templates are the rendering engine of Dynamicweb merging the markup (or XSLT) with the dynamicweb values delivered by the system.
Template language looks like normal markup with comment style variables: <h1><--@TagName--><h1>. Runtime the <--@TagName--> is replaced by a value set with .
Template tag reference: http://templates.dynamicweb-cms.com/
Implementing designs with Dynamicweb templates: http://developer.dynamicweb-cms.com/documentation/for-designers.aspx

code.title: Render a template
code.description: Full template example

member.summary: Sets a tag as its object value for use in Razor templates.
member.param: The value of the tag as an object.
member.remarks: If the template is Razor the value will persist as an object of the passed type and can be used directly in the template. In this way it is possible to pass a full object, i.e. a 'Person', 'Product' or similar to the template engine. If the template being used is HTML or XSLT the passed value is converted to either string, integer, boolean, date, double or decimal.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Template.TagExists(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a tag exists in the loaded template.
member.param: The name of tag to check for.
member.returns: true if the tag is found in the template; otherwise false
member.remarks: Used for optimizing performance. If the value of a tag is expensive to render, there is no need to execute the code if the template is not going to use the data.

code.description: Use TagExists to avoid expensive operations

example.code: Dim t As New Template("MyFolder/MyTemplate.html") t.SetTag("MyTag", "Hello world!") If t.TagExists("MyOtherTag") Then t.SetTag("MyOtherTag", RunExpensiveOperation()) End If

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Template.TagExists(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tags the exists.

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Template.LoopExists(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a loop exists in the loaded template.
member.param: The name of loop to check for.
member.returns: true if the loop is found in the template; otherwise false
member.remarks: Used for optimizing performance. If the loop is expensive to render, there is no need to execute the code if the template is not going to use the data.

code.description: Use LoopExists to avoid expensive operations

example.code: 'Load a template from /Files/Templates/MyFolder/MyTemplate.html Dim t As New Template("MyFolder/MyTemplate.html") 'Set a tag value t.SetTag("MyTag", "Hello world!") 'Check if the loop exists in template before getting the data If t.LoopExists("MyLoop") Then Dim loopTemplate As Template = t.GetLoop("MyLoop") For Each p As Content.Page In Content.Page.GetPagesByAreaID(1) loopTemplate.SetTag("PageName", p.MenuText) loopTemplate.CommitLoop() Next End If

member.name: M:Dynamicweb.Rendering.Template.GetLoop(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a loop.
member.returns: An instance of template representing the markup of the loop.

code.description: Template usage example with loop

example.code:
'Load a template from /Files/Templates/MyFolder/MyTemplate.html Dim t As New Template("MyFolder/MyTemplate.html") 'Set a tag value t.SetTag("MyTag", "Hello world!")
'Create a loop in the template Dim loopTemplate As Template = t.GetLoop("MyLoop") For Each p As Content.Page In Content.Page.GetPagesByAreaID(1) loopTemplate.SetTag("PageName", p.MenuText) loopTemplate.CommitLoop() Next
'Return the parsed template Return t.Output()

member.name: T:Dynamicweb.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Dynamicweb namespace contains fundamental classes and basic infrastucture of Dynamicweb application. The sub namespaces to Dynamicweb is the main functionality of Dynamicweb. Dynamicweb.Content contains the API for managing content, items and the system it self. Dynamicweb.Frontend is the runtime executing the frontend of the website running Dynamicweb through the class.
